liberty.title: Liberty Mutual Insurance
liberty.clientContent:
As a consultant at Publicis Sapient, I work on a team building iOS and Android telematics applications for Liberty Mutual Insurance. Leveraging React Native, we are able to maintain a mono-repo which compiles to three different applications with various branding options.

As part of the team I continue to make our library of shared components cleaner and more robust and work to improve our interactions with the client controlled backend and third party native libraries. I have also strived to improve analytics and performance monitoring which has lead to an increase in app store ratings, decrease in customer service calls, and decrease in crash rates across all apps. In order to ensure the longterm success of the project and team, I create, maintain, and update shared documentation across subjects such as our tech stack, tools, and various procedural guidelines.
liberty.description: At Publicis Sapient, Henry Kean works as part of a product consulting team for Liberty  Mutual's Telematics applicaitons, planning and building new features, maintaining and improving an existing component library, and making overall improvements to increase revenue and decrease customer service calls. Using React Native, Swift, Java, Apollo Client (GraphQL).

sportsrecruits.title: SportsRecruits
sportsrecruits.clientContent:
SportsRecruits is a SaaS startup that allows student athletes to take the recruiting process into their own hands.

When I first started at SportsRecruits, there was little to no focus on analytics or SEO. During my time with the company I worked to not only raise awareness of these issues, but to rebuild and optimize pages so that it could track and grow its organic traffic. It saw its organic traffic grow significantly which directly lead to an increase in paid users and revenue for the company.

I also worked to push the team towards a consolidated code base built with a single API and front-end that was structured based on a consistent design language and style guide. When I first started there were three different web frameworks (Ember.js, Vue.js, CodeIgniter) with two different backend resources (CodeIgniter, and a Laravel based API). Now it is building a single front-end component library in Vue.js based on a style guide to decrease development time and the need for design QA. The team also consolidated its backend resources into a single Laravel API so that the code would stay concise and in one place.
sportsrecruits.description: At SportsRecruits, Henry Kean worked as part of a product team, planning and building new features, running site maintenance, and improving existing features on a SaaS product. Stack used: HTML, CSS/SCSS, javascript, PHP, MySQL, Vue.js, Ember.js, Laravel, and CodeIgniter.

patron.title: Patrón Spirits Company
patron.clientContent: Working on a small, collaborative team of designers, copywriters, and engineers building and maintaining all of Patrón Spirit Company’s digital experiences, we were constantly tasked with coming up with new, engaging ideas and projects that could be built on time and under budget. These projects, including multi-platform voice applications, Patrón’s Margarita of the year, and unique product landing pages such as the Patrón x Guillermo del Toro bottle helped Patrón to sell 2.5 million cases of tequila and grow to a $5.1 billion company.
patron.description: As an experience engineer, Henry Kean worked on a small, collaborative team of designers, copywriters, and engineers building and maintaining all of Patrón Spirit Company’s digital experiences. Developing with SCSS, JSTL/JSP, jQuery, and Javascript

usaa.title: USAA
usaa.clientContent: USAA had recently hired Sapient.Razorfish to run their social media campaigns when I was approached to build a proof of concept for their interactive Memorial Day Poppy wall experience. The proof of concept lead us to win the job, which required a 2 week turn around. Working with one other developer, while fully booked on another client, we were able to get it finished on time, under budget, and exceeding expectations; making close to a million social impressions and engagements reaching into the hundreds of thousands.
usaa.description: Henry Kean was approached to build a proof of concept, and later a production-ready experience for USAA's interactive Memorial Day Poppy wall experience using HTML, SCSS, jQuery, and GSAP (Greensock Animation Plugin).

bog_bespoke.title: Bog Bespoke
bog_bespoke.clientContent:
Bog Bespoke is an heirloom quality, bespoke furniture company based in Maine. I was asked to design and build a web presence for them that would serve as a place to display their work and take requests from new clients.

The two most important factors were price and the ability to add new content and pages without the need to write any code. To keep cost low I built the site using Grav CMS, a free flat file content management system with a large community so I had resources to turn to in case I encountered any issues or challenges along the way. I then chose to deploy the site using Heroku. While this proved to be a more difficult route than using AWS or Google Cloud Platform, it wound up being the most cost effective solution (maximum $7/month) since I needed support for PHP and the potential to read and write to the server numerous times a month for content updates.

Working closely with Bog’s founder we were able to launch a site in roughly a month’s time, that met their financial needs and gave them the ability to freely update the sites content.
bog_bespoke.description: Henry Kean was asked to design and build a web presence for Bog Bespoke that would serve as a place to display their work and take requests from new clients. The site was built using Grav CMS, PHP, Javascript, Twig, and YAML.
